assistant: Transcultural nursing is a branch of nursing focused on providing culturally sensitive and appropriate care to individuals, families, and groups from diverse cultural backgrounds. It uses comparative cross-cultural research to understand how beliefs, values, and practices influence health, illness, care, and outcomes, and aims to integrate this cultural knowledge into education, research, and clinical practice to meet patients’ cultural needs and improve nursing care across cultures.
